ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] how to avoid too many redirects out of scope
ygData.msgSnippet: I guess putting the domain/host-Rule as the last Rule in your chain Would have that effect - but that Would also avoid redirects on embeds that you might Want

I guess putting the domain/host-Rule as the last Rule in your chain Would h=
ave that effect - but that Would also avoid redirects on embeds that you mi=
ght Want to include

Best
Bjarne

Sendt fra min iPhone

Den 7. nov. 2015 kl=
. 12.12 skrev tlr@...<mailto:tlr@...> [archive-crawler] <archive-crawle=
r@yahoogroups.com<mailto:archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com>>:



How can I av=
oid too many redirects 'R' out of domain scope comming from the Transclusio=
nDecideRule maxTranshops?  If i limit it to 1 i loose included content from=
 e.g. wordpress pages linking to wp.com<http://wp.com> css and js files and=
 images og if I use the HopsPathMatchesRegExpDecideRule i also loose the re=
directs within scope.


Thanks for any hints!


Best Regards

Tue





--_000_A772DE71DB0B4C2682C538DBF1D8C1EAstatsbiblioteketdk_
